Topic.Title: Yahoo stock off to a nice start again today.

Message.Msg: Final verdict Honestly, Total has been unable to keep up with Exxon since 2010, but since last year, Total has been ramping up its efforts to rejoin the big boys of the oil and gas sector. The company has achieved a strong production base in Africa, and for the next three years, it is striving to capitalize in the Middle East as well by building a $1.5 billion condensate refinery in Qatar. Total is surely a buy for the long-term, while dismal performance of Petrobras is a clear sigh of the company's struggles and efforts. While Exxon has undeniable potential, when compared to Total, I believe the French company holds the upper hand.

Message.Msg: Last Q, MSFT BOD told Ballmer to make a decision regarding MSFT Online service business, sell it, dispose it, write it off whatever is relevant to MSFT. This business, for over 10 years now is on "Red", never made profit yet, and last year losses is over $2B. However this latest news about AAPL making Bing as search default could change the equation. On the other hand, YHOO wants their search back from MSFT. My final analysis we might have a cash-rich split deal here that Bing will be included in the deal. My personal opinion only. I see YHOO $30 to $35 this year.

Topic.Title: The good old “cash-rich split”

Message.Msg: I hear you, but don't see it that way. Yahoo will bring all the money back to California and pay the taxes. Ballmer is about to shock Wall Street "experts" yet again (which he really relishes doing) with yet another good quarter as Windows Phones, Windows Tablets, Azure, Enterprise and MS Office by subscription are all new revenue streams. Plus the Enterprise side of MSFT is eating up the landscape. The new deal with Apple and Bing pretty much seals that deal. Yahoo will probably be bought by Microsoft, Apple or Google in a short time with Marissa Mayer taking the helm of whichever ship that buys Yahoo. The tax savings is paltry compared to the bidding war potential that Dan Loeb wants to happen. Muddying the waters with a split would make selling the house messier. I did M&A's since the 1980's for 3 Fortune 500 companies. Buyers don't want to buy sticky companies. They want them clean. Yahoo will be bought for over $50. Possibly $60. Not just for the value, but because the meat clever the buyer will have against the other two.

Message.Title: Yahoo & 49ers team up for 10 year partnership
Message.Msg: SANTA CLARA -- The San Francisco 49ers on Monday named its biggest Silicon Valley tech teammate yet for its new stadium, signing an exclusive fantasy football and social media deal with Yahoo (YHOO). The deal will allow fans to upload photos to Flickr, which Yahoo owns, during the game and potentially see their shots on the stadium big screen. Niner faithful can also visit the Yahoo Fantasy Football lounge inside the stadium's swanky suite tower. Terms of the deal were not disclosed. Yahoo will be named "the exclusive online sports content, social networking, and photo and video sharing partner" of the new stadium and the Niners. Yahoo, based one town over from the new stadium in Sunnyvale, has large offices on Great America Parkway in Santa Clara just one mile from the stadium.

Topic.Title: Yahoo & 49ers team up for 10 year partnership

Message.Title: DRAM $4.25 UP AGAIN...RALLY TO $30+ CERTAIN...1) MEMORY PRICES EXPLODING UP, 2) NEW HUGE DEAL WITH AMD...WAS $30+ IN 2010...1.7M O/S SHARES
Message.Msg: Dataram (NASDAQ: DRAM - $8M market cap) is poised for a huge break out – double, quadruple, etc. from today’s $4+...just look at its chart! DRAM is trading at 0.2 X sales compared to 1.2 sector. In last Q earnings ending January 31, the CEO predicted that because of a recovery in memory prices DRAM would be profitable in 2013 and beyond. Since then memory prices have jumped more than doubles and DRAM has recently announced a huge manufacturing deal with AMD on top of that. Two main reasons for rapidly improving fundamentals: 1…Memory prices have almost doubled this year and were 70% higher in the quarter to be reported soon vs. the previous quarter. Traditionally, the memory business was DRAM's main business having been a pioneer and a respected company since 1967. DRAM prices continue to literally explode during the current quarter and are expected to continue to go up into 2015 due to manufacturing shortages and high demand. 2....AMD and DRAM recently announced in May (5/8/2013 AMD and 5/10/2013 DRAM) that they have agreed on a significant partnership. DRAM will be AMD's memory-manufacturing partner to produce AMD's new Gamer Series memory. Gamer Series memory is compatible with AMD and Intel platforms, supporting both AMP and XMP memory profiles. The software is based on DRAM's RAMDisk technology. "AMD Radeon RG2133 Gamer Series Memory is armed with features designed to outperform the competition on any task," said Roman Kyrychynskyi, product director, Graphics Business Unit, AMD. "Designed with multi-platform compatibility in mind, the AMD Radeon RG2133 brings cutting-edge technology, as well as uncompromising quality and compatibility for PC gamers. "AMD and Dataram have worked together to significantly enhance the dynamic background load-and-save feature in order to create a seamless, non-volatile RAMDisk experience," said Jason Caulkins, CTO, Dataram. "This underscores AMD and Dataram's commitment to delivering the fastest/best memory products."

Message.Msg: According to CNBC, Sprint just filed a lawsuit against Dish & Clearwire "citing illegality of Dish tender offer for Clearwire."

Topic.Title: The NSA admits listening to U.S. phone calls without warrants

Message.Msg: A bug or other device needs to be placed or used to obtain the message or to overhear the conversation. The government is big, but is not big enough to overhear every phone conversation being made at one time. Part of a court order is to focus the recording to a specific phone number or numbers. It takes time to place the device to overhear the message. So what I disagree with is that a single person can place a wiretap on any person immediately or even in a very short period because I believe it takes time to setup the listening device.

Message.Title: buying Yahoo on Margin/holding overnight..
Message.Msg: Any thoughts about buying Yahoo on Margin at this price, a margin loan will be interest free for 3 day's, so im thinking of day trading a position equal to my Yahoo holdings and maybe picking up a few extra bucks that way. Also, does this make sence, I buy 2000 on margin and hold it overnight, then the next day do the same thing, that way when the Alibaba IPO news comes out I'll be holding those shares instead of buying after the new's, all the time selling before I get charged for that loan, Im thinking that new's alone could be a $2.00 to the upside if not more, Im at 50 % profit already so even a small loss day to day won't hurt if this thing takes a few down day's, but the reward for holding extra shares when an IPO is announced will be to good to pass up. Even if it goes down fast Im thinking I can hold onto them for a year and the interest will only be a little over $3,000, Alibaba should announce by then so the price should go back up protecting me from a loss. Of course praying at the same time won't hurt !!! Any thoughts... Thanks...
